intro: Sobralia hirta, commonly known as the hairy sobralia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, thriving in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are usually leathery and covered in fine hairs, giving it the "hairy" descriptor in its common name. The flowers, which bloom in summer, come in a range of colors including yellow, orange, and red, making it a popular ornamental plant.
